channel.title: Adding music to pages?
channel.description:
Hello,
Is it possible to keep the same music running whilst they change website pages or does the music have to stop when they change page?
Thanks

item.title: Adding music to pages?
item.dc:creator: @Cald_Panda Cald Panda
item.description:
@Cald_Panda wrote:

I suggest changing the page using a switch statement with the GET variable. For example:

switch ($_GET['page']) { case 'about': echo 'This is the about page.'; break; case 'lol': echo 'I did it for the lolz.'; break; default: echo 'Welcome to my website?'; break; }
Put this in a frame. Play the music in the part of the page that isn’t going to be reloading.

Or… you could use DOM to dynamically change the page. Then the page isn’t actually changed. Just the content.

item.title: Adding music to pages?
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:3, topic:232438”]It’s possible, but you have to realise that a page that plays music is fucking irritating and will get less traffic.[/quote]This is correct.

Also, you could design a flash web page, in which case the browser never leaves the actual index page, so the music can run in the same frame as the website.

item.title: Adding music to pages?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Yes, you just need to divide the page into two frames, one with the player, and the other with the content. When the content frame changes, the music player frame will be unaffected.
